1184912169575616512.text: But that's not even the full story, rather than comply with the clear statutory deadline (included in bipartisan legislation signed by the President) to issue the Fed Reg notice, @HUDgov is still withholding the notice for PUERTO RICO.

1184912168870916096.text: Low and middle-income families can’t wait 547 days to rebuild after a devastating storm.

1184912168208273408.text:
Issuing the Federal Register notice has taken longer in recent years.

After Sandy in 2012, it took 35 days.  After the 2017 hurricanes, it took 145 days.  And more recently it took 547 days, and even then the notice came only after Congress included a deadline by law.

1184912167470063616.text: Without this notice, states (like NC) cannot submit action plans to @Hudgov, sign a grant agreement, and begin to use the $—necessary steps that take at least several months once the notice is issued.

1184912166777954305.text:
Unfortunately, Congress has never formally approved the CDBG-DR program. 

This means each time Congress gives $, @HUDgov must issue a notice in the Federal Register that outlines how the funds can be used.

1184912166073319424.text:
In 2017 alone, Congress set aside more than $35 billion across the federal government for people recovering from major hurricanes: Harvey, Irma, & Maria.

To put this into perspective, HUD’s entire budget in the last fiscal year was approximately $54 billion.

1184912165398044672.text: Since 1993, Congress has provided more than $86 billion in funding for the CDBG-DR program.  As the severity and frequency of storms have increased, so has the need for funding. *climate change*

1184912164768882690.text: The grants primarily benefit low- and moderate-income people in the most impacted and distressed areas.

1184912164022341632.text: .@HUDgov’s Community Development Block Grant-Disaster Recovery program (CDBG-DR) is a flexible & vital tool for states & municipalities to recover from major disasters. Grantees use this funding to reconstruct damaged housing & repair public facilities such as community centers.
